sentence.Network_en: The earliest seismograph was invented by a Chinese named Zhangheng in the Han dynasty.
sentence.Network_cn: 中国汉代的张衡最早发明地震仪。

sentence.Network_en: Today, quartz crystal clocks are generally used on the seismograph stations.
sentence.Network_cn: 目前, 地震台站一般采用石英晶体钟.

sentence.Network_en: These things entail that the seismograph becomes rather bully.
sentence.Network_cn: 这使得地震仪体积笨重.

entry.def: A seismograph is an instrument for recording and measuring the strength of earthquakes.

means.word_mean: 1. a measuring instrument for detecting and measuring the intensity and direction and duration of movements of the ground (as an earthquake)
